nodes.text: Dolla was an astronomical object located in the Dolla system, a part of the Videnda sector in the Western Reaches portion of the Outer Rim Territories. It was situated at the junction of the hyperlanes known as the Nothoiin Corridor, which connected it to the Bavva system in the Anoat sector and the Eriadu system of the Seswenna sector, and the Anturi Reach, which linked it to the Senex sector's Yetoom system.

Space surrounding Dolla was explored between 3000 BBY and 1000 BBY, and the celestial body was a part of the Galactic Republic during the Clone Wars of 22 BBY–19 BBY. Dolla served as a major Imperial Navy staging area of the Outer Rim Territories during the Galactic Civil War, and at some point between 0 ABY and 2 ABY, Imperial Governor Jedselk of the Jjannex sector planet Sellasas was promoted to the governorship of Dolla. The population of the Dolla system around 25 ABY numbered between one and ten million.

Dolla was first mentioned in the 1994 sourcebook Galaxy Guide 10: Bounty Hunters, which was was authored by Rick D. Stuart and published by West End Games for use with Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the Dolla system, and therefore the celestial body itself, in grid square L-18.
